alert.note: Alert for Humboldt; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 8:10PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nevada and northwest Nevada, including the following counties, in north central Nevada, Lander. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern Lander and Southeastern Humboldt Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
